posts.post_content: Heaven forbid they make a planeswalker that requires subtlety to play. Probably won't be standard playable, but I like him. 1st ability protects himself, 2nd ability gives card advantage, ultimate should win you the game. I can't see how any planeswalker can be rated lower than 4, especially this guy.

posts.post_content: Pulled two at the prerelease one in my pack and other in prize boosters. I think his quite good. His +1 nerfs 1/1 tokens while damping hits against him. His -2 nets you 1 or 2 cards and it depends on the skill of the person your versusing, you could benefit from it. His -8 is more multiplayer orientated and probably won't be used in standard.Overall I think Jace will see some standard play. As for me Ill run 3 in my Azorius control deck.

Posted By: TheDarkLight (10/3/2012 4:43:02 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
+1 Softens attackers and builds counters.  
-2 Draw 1-2 cards, based on your choice. If you pull something great its guaranteed to be in your hand if you choose.  
-8 Should win you the game.  
  
Also, when a card affects multiple players why do people jump to the conclusion "this is a multiplayer card"? Maybe its because I mostly play 1v1, but they just throw wordings like that to appeal to a minority crowd. His ultimate would have the same exact effect in a 1v1 if it was single target, and still would probably win you the game. Unless your opponent has [witchbane orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=witchbane orb), but that is not a common scenario.  
  
I thought he was weak at first glance, but then I took a second to analyze his abilities. I am blown away by that art as well, cant imagine why someone wouldn't like it... Can you draw anything close to that???  
 5/5

-8 Should win you the game.

His ultimate would have the same exact effect in a 1v1 if it was single target, and still would probably win you the game. Unless your opponent has witchbane orb, but that is not a common scenario.

I thought he was weak at first glance, but then I took a second to analyze his abilities. I am blown away by that art as well, cant imagine why someone wouldn't like it... Can you draw anything close to that???
5/5

posts.post_content:
@TheWrathofShane  
 Witchbane orb won't stop his last ability because it doesn't target anything. And even if it did, that ability would rather say "target library" and there is nothing in the game, as far as I know, that can protect your library from being targeted.  
  
 New art is nice and I doubt people dislike the quality of it. It just we used to see Jace differently. His face shape changed, hair color and style also changed. The only thing that proves him to be Jace is his outfit and those symbols on his face. And name of the card, obviously. It is first time when planeswalker is being changed that much. Otherwise, art is great.  
  
 I like this version as it's well balanced and not as specific as Memory Adept which is only really playable in mill. He could have been just a bit more powerful, considering the power level of the set (He is 4 turn drop and your opponent might already have 5/X and so on). On the other hand, altering his first ability even to give -2/-0 would make him almost ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: Afael (10/6/2012 1:34:17 AM)

posts.post_content:
This is about even with [Chandra Ablaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Ablaze). Both mimic a well-liked spell in their color ([Wheel of Fortune](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wheel of Fortune) and [Fact or Fiction](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fact or Fiction)) and have an ultimate that impresses on the awesomeness factor.  
More than that, they've got a "casual planeswalker" feel. That's something nice to have around - just as [Sword of Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of Vengeance)'s existence (sort of) balances the existence of [Sword of War and Peace](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sword of War and Peace), planeswalker cards like this are necessary to balance the existence of [Jace, the Mind Sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the Mind Sculptor). Note to self: failed on my resolution not to mention *him.*

Posted By: BagsMcpiper (10/13/2012 7:30:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Let's take a look at Jace's second ability:
  
   
If your opponent splits the piles really well, you get the best card out of 3 draws.
  
If your opponent makes a mistake, you get the 2 best cards out of 3 draws.
  
   
Now here's the thing:
  
Jace's second ability can be used twice over two turns (more if you stall the game and power him up with the +1 ability). This strategy seems very solid.
  
   
Add the other abilities; the fact that Jace powers-up by shutting down infinite sized 1/1 armies is incredible; especially since the fixed artifact [Cumber Stone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cumber Stone) was also 4 mana to do the same thing, but that card didn't have all these other options!
  
   
If the game gets stalled for too long, Jace has his ultimate. Last time I checked, Blue was more than happy to stall the game with white cards that use Detain or [Supreme Verdict](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Supreme Verdict).
posts.html:
Let's take a look at Jace's second ability:

If your opponent splits the piles really well, you get the best card out of 3 draws.
If your opponent makes a mistake, you get the 2 best cards out of 3 draws.

Now here's the thing:
Jace's second ability can be used twice over two turns (more if you stall the game and power him up with the +1 ability). This strategy seems very solid.

Add the other abilities; the fact that Jace powers-up by shutting down infinite sized 1/1 armies is incredible; especially since the fixed artifact Cumber Stone was also 4 mana to do the same thing, but that card didn't have all these other options!

If the game gets stalled for too long, Jace has his ultimate. Last time I checked, Blue was more than happy to stall the game with white cards that use Detain or Supreme Verdict.

Posted By: Breaker_Ki (10/9/2012 11:13:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Lash\_of\_Dragonbreath  
You're either underestimating this card, or overestimating [Chandra Ablaze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chandra Ablaze), or both. Chandra Ablaze was weak because it costed 6 CMC, and for that much, you're really looking for something that immediately contributes to winning the game. She just didn't do enough for her cost. Jace, Architect of Thought costs 4 CMC. The difference is night and day. I suspect that if Chandra Ablaze were to cost 4 CMC, she would be a quite popular and powerful planeswalker, instead of merely being a casual card.
